poem:
### The Green Grotto

Underneath the lights,  
the silent folds of brown  
envelop the whispers—  
currency crinkles   
in the pockets of blue,  
where trust should lie.  
  
A young heart shivers,  
rebuffed advances  
in a crocus dawn—  
yet the weight  
of the gold-stuffed hamper  
tells no tales.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Met officers allegedly took hampers and cash bribes to help Fayed persecute staff Scotland Yard is facing claims that corrupt police officers helped Mohamed Al Fayed in persecuting members of his staff, including a young woman who allegedly rebuffed the Harrods owner’s sexual advances. One detective constable, who is accused of regularly taking cash bribes to carry out Fayed’s wishes, was secretly given a mobile phone from Harrods to facilitate his illicit work, according to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
